intro: Heudusa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heudus, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. The plant is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Heudusa species are often found in rocky soils and are adapted to withstand periods of drought. These plants are sometimes cultivated for their ornamental value due to their delicate appearance and ability to add visual interest to gardens.
